intro: Sida oregana, commonly known as common ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant has hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as fields and roadsides. Sida oregana is known for its fibrous stems and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
